result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronell Dashawn Geralds was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Short-barreled Shotgun/Rifle, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.28(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 6/2/16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 6/2/16; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Restitution is set at zero.

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for school and work, if employed. Credit for 81 days time served.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence
Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronell Dashawn Geralds

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Also referenced ATN #41004483103084, arrest date 4-8-14, MPD3.

Defendant Ronell Dashawn Geralds in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Ronell Dashawn Geralds in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ AB
  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

  The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 11 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 81 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for school and work, if employed. 
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 6/2/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 6/2/2016; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution is set at zero
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Victoria M McCandless in court, defendant Ronell Dashawn Geralds not in court, in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 6/2/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Ronell Dashawn Geralds in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Ronell Dashawn Geralds in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Jeffery Pierson.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant Ronell Dashawn Geralds in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Ronell Dashawn Geralds in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
